billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO HOUSING, CONSTRUCTION AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

title: Requires public housing authorities to install a functioning carbon monoxide detector in each of its tenant dwelling units
summary: Requires public housing authorities to install and maintain a functioning carbon monoxide detector in each of its tenant dwelling units, excluding units whose sole source of heat is electric heat.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2027

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public housing law, in relation to required installation
of carbon monoxide detectors

SUMMARY:
§152-a. Safety requirements; carbon monoxide. Each authority shall
install and maintain a functioning carbon monoxide detector in every
tenant dwelling unit, excluding those dwelling units having electric
heat as their sole source of heat.

JUSTIFICATION:
Carbon Monoxide is considered a silent killer which has no warnings.
This odorless and invisible poison gas can kill an occupant of a
household within an hour of inhalation. The proposed bill would enact
legislation to require public housing authorities to install these
lifesaving devices in every unit. Each device is estimated to cost $10.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the first of October next succeeding the
date on which it shall have become a law.
